Course Section: BIOL_V 155-T09 - Human Biology: Physiology and Introductory Anatomy
Course Section Definition Public Notes: Students may only register for one required course activity per lecture/lab/discussion or waitlist if there is no space available. Students will be removed from the waitlist if they already have a spot in a section of the course.  For example, students may not register for multiple labs or discussion, including their respective waitlists.  BEING ON THE WAITLIST DOES NOT GUARANTEE YOU A SPACE IN THE LECTURE, LAB, OR DISSCUSSION.

Course Section: CAP_V 100-E02 - WRTI RES SS & H
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Course title: "Introduction to Writing and Research in the Social Sciences and the Humanities."

This course is part of the Coordinated Arts Program, Environment and Society stream, https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/streams/environment-society/. Students must register in both Term 1 and Term 2 courses in CAP, and must register in the same section (i.e. timeslot) for both CAP 100 and CAP 101 (e.g. CAP_V 100-E02 in Term 1, and CAP_V 101-E02 in Term 2).

This course is clustered with ENST_V 211-199, and POLI_V 100-228. For POLI_V 100, please register in POLI_V 100-228 and one of the following discussion sections: POLI_V 100-LX1, POLI_V 100-LX2, POLI_V 100-LX4, POLI_V 100-LX5, or POLI_V 100-LX6. ENST_V 211-199 does not have any additional discussion sections.Follow the prompts to register in all stream seminars (1), lectures (2), and tutorials (1-2) each term. For step-by-step instructions, please visit: https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/program/registration/

All Arts and BDes students with first-year standing are eligible to take CAP 100 and CAP 101.

If you encounter any issues with registration into CAP, please contact us at support.fyip@ubc.ca

Course Section: CAP_V 100-P01 - WRTI RES SS & H
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Course title: "Introduction to Writing and Research in the Social Sciences and the Humanities."

This course is part of the Coordinated Arts Program, Political Science, Philosophy and Economics (PPE) stream, https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/streams/political-science-philosophy-economics-ppe/. Students must register in both Term 1 and Term 2 courses in CAP.

This course is clustered with ECON_V 101-011, and POLI_V 100-227. For ECON_V 101-011, please register in both the lecture, and one of the following discussion sections: ECON_V 101-L9A, or ECON_V 101-L9B. For POLI_V 100-227, please register in both the lecture, and one of the following discussion sections: POLI_V 100-LZ1, POLI_V 100-LZ2, POLI_V 100-LZ3, POLI_V 100-LZ4, POLI_V 100-LZ5, or POLI_V 100-LZ6. CAP_V 100 does not have any additional discussion sections. Follow the prompts to register for all stream seminars (1), lectures (2), and tutorials (2) in Term 1. In Term 2, register for all lectures (3) and tutorials (2). For step-by-step instructions, please visit: https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/program/registration/

All Arts students with first-year standing are eligible to take CAP 100.

If you encounter any issues with registration into CAP, please contact us at support.fyip@ubc.ca

This course is part of the Coordinated Arts Program, Political Science, Philosophy and Economics (PPE) stream, https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/streams/political-science-philosophy-economics-ppe/. Students must register in both Term 1 and Term 2 courses in CAP.

This course is clustered with ECON_V 101-011, and POLI_V 100-227. For ECON_V 101-011, please register in both the lecture, and one of the following discussion sections: ECON_V 101-L9A, or ECON_V 101-L9B. For POLI_V 100-227, please register in both the lecture, and one of the following discussion sections: POLI_V 100-LZ1, POLI_V 100-LZ2, POLI_V 100-LZ3, POLI_V 100-LZ4, POLI_V 100-LZ5, or POLI_V 100-LZ6. CAP_V 100 does not ​have any additional discussion sections. Follow the prompts to register for all stream seminars (1), lectures (2), and tutorials (2) in Term 1. In Term 2, register for all lectures (3) and tutorials (2). For step-by-step instructions, please visit: https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/program/registration/

All Arts students with first-year standing are eligible to take CAP 100.

If you encounter any issues with registration into CAP, please contact us at support.fyip@ubc.ca

Course Section: CENS_V 104-101 - Canadian Monuments to Central and Eastern European History
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
This course investigates Canadian monuments to communities that immigrated from Central and Eastern Europe to Canada. Some of these monuments speak to memories that are integral to Canadian identity, such as the National Holocaust Memorial. Others, such as the Memorial to the Victims of Communism, represent interventions in controversial debates. We will examine the cultures of remembrance surrounding these public artworks from a variety of perspectives, including memory studies, art history, urban planning, cultural studies, postcolonial studies, and decolonization. At the same time, we will review the history that brought the settler communities from Austria, Czechia, Slovakia, Hungary, Poland, Ukraine, and Russia to Canada. Our focus will lie on communities and memorials that have featured prominently in public debates about Canadian identity over the past two decades.

Check out more information  here

Interested in other courses from the Department of Central, Eastern and Northern European Studies? Click here for more information

Course Section: CHEM_V 111-XMT - Structure, Bonding, and Equilibrium in Chemistry
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
XMT section is ONLY for students who are REATTEMPTING this course. If you didn’t pass the course before, but you had a passing lab score, please register for a lecture, a lab and XMT wait list. 
 
Department will manually check your lab score and your eligibility for XMT. If eligible, students on the wait list will receive an email notification to accept the XMT spot. Once registered into XMT, your previous lab score will be reused.
 
If students mistakenly wait list for XMT, you will be removed from the wait list without further notice.
 
If students are attempting the course for the first time, please register for a lab, i.g. L02, L06, and L07.
